conbody.p:
The parameters for configuring a REST server are listed in the following table. REST server parameters
Parameter
Description
Server Name* A unique alphanumeric name to identify the REST server. The name cannot exceed 50 characters.
Host/IP* IP address or hostname of the REST server.
Port Port number used for the REST server. The valid range is 0-65535. Default value is 80.
URI Path URL path to access the REST-based web services. The URI should be valid path with / characters as appropriate, for example /source1/source2.
Request Type
Request method used by the REST server. Only POST method is supported.
Content Type
The format of data for the notification. The content type specified in the template is used in HTTP Content-Type header while sending HTTP (REST) request to back-office server. Specifying this helps the receiver to interpret the information correctly.
Valid values:
application/xml
application/json
text/plain
Default: application/xml
Authentication
If authentication is required, select the check box to enable the user name and password parameters for the authentication. The authentication is done via HTTP.
Default value: false.
User Name The user name required for authentication. It can have a maximum 100 characters.
Password The password required for authentication. It can have a maximum 15 characters.
Description Description of the REST server.
Secondary Server
Secondary server configuration for REST server is optional.
If NS fails to send the notification over the primary rest server (and the retry count is exhausted), it then tries to send the notification via the secondary server (with the same number of retries) if defined.
Enable Secondary Server Select this check box and provide the parameters for a secondary REST server.
Host/IP* IP address or hostname of the secondary REST server.
Port Port number used for the secondary REST server. The valid range is 0-65535. Default value is 80.
URI Path URL path to access the REST-based web services for the secondary server. The URI should be valid path with / characters as appropriate, for example /source1/source2.
Request Type
Request method used by the secondary REST server. Only POST method is supported.
Content Type The format of data for the notification. See the description above.
Authentication If authentication is required for the secondary server, select the check box to enable the user name and password parameters for the authentication. The authentication is done via HTTP.
User Name The user name for the secondary server. It can have a maximum 100 characters.
Password The password for the secondary server. It can have a maximum 15 characters.
Description Description of the secondary REST server.
